title: Enacts into law major components of legislation which are necessary to implement the education, labor and family assistance budget
summary: Relates to contracts of excellence, library funding, reimbursement of school districts, electronic format materials and reporting requirements, apportionment of school aid, building aid, foundation aid base, apportionment of school aid and of current year approved expenditures for debt service, apportionment of transportation aid, academic enhancement aid, incentive operating aid for reorganized districts, high tax aid, Medicaid reimbursement, gap elimination adjustment, school district performance incentive grants, grants, maximum class size, apportionment of funds to the education jobs fund, school bus driver training, support of public libraries; Relates to the education performance initiative; Eliminates the New York State Theatre Institute; Provides regulatory relief in the area of procurement of goods and services for SUNY and CUNY and allows SUNY to enter into public-private partnerships; Reduces the maximum TAP award from $5,000 to $4,000; Requires the add-back of certain pension and annuity income for purposes of calculating TAP awards; Establishes parity in TAP eligibility for all students in default of federal student loans by rendering such students ineligible; Creates a new TAP schedule for students who are married without children; Increases the academic standards for TAP eligibility; Eliminates TAP awards for graduate students; Extends the physician loan forgiveness program; Extends the nursing faculty loan forgiveness program until June 30, 2016 school year; Extends the social worker loan forgiveness program until June 30, 2016; Caps STAR exemption benefits at two percent annual growth, creates a mechanism for STAR recipients to repay improper exemption; Shifts the state share of room and board costs;
